abs.controller

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • abs.controller.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    The Utilities class provides reads and imports data from file and can export the system back to file.

    Can be run with default data with a no parameter constructor or can use other data files set manually.
    You can read all data or just one or the other, same goes for writeData.

    See Also:
    Utilities(), Utilities(String, String, String, String), readData(), writeData(List, List)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Utilities

        public Utilities()
        Default constructor. Assumes businessinfo.txt and customerinfo.txt use CSV and are stored in ./data/

      • Utilities

        public Utilities(java.lang.String filePath,
                 java.lang.String customerInfoFileName,
                 java.lang.String businessInfoFileName,
                 java.lang.String splitChar)
        Instantiates a new utilities.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Relative file path to data files.
        customerInfoFileName - Name for customer info file.
        businessInfoFileName - Name for business info file.
        splitChar - Character for splitting.

      • readBusinessData

        public int readBusinessData()
        Reads the data from business info file and instantiates it.
        Returns:
        an int to show success/fail. -1 file not found, -2 empty file or invalid formatting, -3 unimplemented, 0 success.

      • readCustomerData

        public int readCustomerData()
        Reads the data from customer file and instantiates it.
        Returns:
        an int to show success/fail. -1 file not found, -2 empty file or invalid formatting, -3 unimplemented, 0 success.

      • readData

        public int readData()
        Reads the data from both files and instantiates it.
        Returns:
        an int to show success/fail. 0 success, -1 unsuccessful
